original: LÖNN, Nils Josef Fredrik, Disponent, Äppelviken, f Höreda, Jönk l, 18/9 98 av snick KAJ Lönn o Selma Ström, gm Margareta Wadman. Folksk, forts.sk, kvällskurs. Typograf Smålands-Tidn, Eksjö, 13—24, fakt v C E Lenanders Tryck, Vvik, 25—30, v Nässjö-Tryckeriet 31—35, tryckeriförest v Ernst Westerbergs Boktryckeri AB, Sthlm (grund 98, AB 16), 36—42, disp sed. 43, styr.led där. Ag fastigh Bromma. Styr.suppl Sv Boktryckarefrn, Sthlms Boktryckarefrn, Tidn AB Sv Morgonbladet, Sv Frimärksbytesfrn, styr.led Frn Kristna Köpmän o Näringsidkare. Resor: Norge 26, Tyskl 36. Hobby: Frimärkssamling. LöNXEGREX, Arvid Emil, fd överingenjör, Finspång, f Hakarp, Jönkps l, 4/10 83 av ma-gasinsförvalt A E Olsson o Josefina Lönnegren, gm Esther Persson. CTL (niaskinbyggn 0 mek tekn) 01—06. Rit v Motala Verkst Nya AB 06—07, konstr v Nydqvist & Holm i Trollhättan 07—11 o v Uddeholms AB i Munkfors 11—14, ritkont.ch v Finspongs Metallverks AB 1 Finspång 14—17, verkst.ing 17—28, verkst.ch 28—32 o verkschef o övering 32—43, numera pensionerad. "LöNNEGREN, Karl Gustaf, Civilingenjör, Loughton, Essex, Engl, f Huskvarna 4/5 96 av brukstjm A E Olsson o Josefina Lönnegren, gm Karin Lion. Studex Jönkp 15, KTH 15—19. Ing v STAL i Finspång fr 20, först anst v beräkn.avd, repr f fman h dess agenter i Japan, Gadelius & Co, 29—32 o repr i Fjärran östern m plac i Shanghai 33, nu anst v ASEA Electric Ltd i London. iLÖNNFÄM, John Olof, Kamrer, Strömsbro, f Revesjö, Älvsb l, 10/3 08 av lantbr J Andersson o Maria Haglund, gm Solveig Eriksson. Studex Lund 30, Hälsingborgs hdlsgymn 31. Anst Sv Yllekoncernen AB Tidan 33—37, Gefle Manufaktur AB sed. 37. Odd Fellow, Hdlsklb i Gefle. £ÖWENBORG, Folke Gottfrid, Direktör, Göteborg, f Trollh 3/8 03, gm Sigrid Simonson. Anst sed. 18 i Haraldsons herrekip.AB, inneh av denna 43 t Löwenborgs herrekip.AB omb fma. Resor: Norge, Danm, Span, Frankr, Ital, Tyskl, Skottl, Portug, Afr. Sv roddar-frbs utmt s, Örgryte idr.sällsk:s ftjt, D.M. o S.M. i rodd, D.M. o C.M. i bowling. Hobby: Bowling. IjöWENHARD, Eric Hugo Hilding, Bankdirektör, Stockholm, f Nässjö 7/4 92 av ulöjtn H L o Anna Wadner, gm Ingeborg Lundblad. Realex. Anst Smal Ensk Bk Nässjö o Jönkp 08—16, Sv Hdlsbkn s förest avd.kont Sthlm 16—17, l:e kamr Umeå 18—19, dir Skellefteå 19—22, bitr dir Gävle o Uppsala 22, dir Kristianstad 23—26, avd.dir Nyköping 26—37, i Falun 37—38, dir o led Sthlms.dir samt chef f bkns s:a distr sed. 38. Styr.led Sv Yllekoncernen AB mfl. Resor: Tyskl, Belg, Schweiz, Ital, Tjeckoslov, Österrike.
translated:
LÖNN, Nils Josef Fredrik, Manager, Äppelviken, b. Höreda, Jönköping County, 18/9 1898, son of carpenter KAJ Lönn and Selma Ström, m. Margareta Wadman. Primary school, advanced school, evening course. Typesetter at Smålands-Tidningen, Eksjö, 1913-1924, invoice clerk at C E Lenanders Tryck, Vvik, 1925-1930, at Nässjö-Tryckeriet 1931-1935, printing supervisor at Ernst Westerbergs Boktryckeri AB, Stockholm (established 1898, Ltd since 1916), 1936-1942, manager since 1943, board member there. Property agent in Bromma. Supervisor's deputy of the Swedish Printers Association, Stockholm Printers Association, Tidning AB Sv Morgonbladet, Sv Frimärksbytesfrn, board member of the Christian Merchants and Traders Association. Travels: Norway 1926, Germany 1936. Hobby: Stamp collecting. 

LÖNN, Arvid Emil, former chief engineer, Finspång, b. Hakarp, Jönköping County, 4/10 1883, son of warehouse manager A E Olsson and Josefina Lönnegren, m. Esther Persson. Central Technical School (mechanical engineering) 1901-1906. Draftsman at Motala Verkstads Nya AB 1906-1907, designer at Nydqvist & Holm in Trollhättan 1907-1911 and Uddeholms AB in Munkfors 1911-1914, head of design department at Finspångs Metallverks AB in Finspång 1914-1917, works engineer 1917-1928, chief engineer 1928-1932, works manager and chief engineer 1932-1943, now retired. 

LÖNN, Karl Gustaf, Civil engineer, Loughton, Essex, England, b. Huskvarna 4/5 1896, son of factory worker A E Olsson and Josefina Lönnegren, m. Karin Lion. Graduated from Jönköping 1915, KTH (Royal Institute of Technology) 1915-1919. Engineer at STAL in Finspång since 1920, initially employed in the calculation department, representative for the company's agents in Japan, Gadelius & Co, 1929-1932 and representative in the Far East with placement in Shanghai, currently employed at ASEA Electric Ltd in London. 

LÖNNEGREN, John Olof, Accountant, Strömsbro, b. Revesjö, Älvsborg County, 10/3 1908, son of farmer J Andersson and Maria Haglund, m. Solveig Eriksson. Graduated from Lund University 1930, Hälsingborgs Commercial Gymnasium 1931. Employed at Sv Yllekoncernen AB in Tidan 1933-1937, Gefle Manufaktur AB since 1937. Odd Fellow, Commercial Club in Gefle. 

LÖWENBORG, Folke Gottfrid, Director, Gothenburg, b. Trollhättan 3/8 1903, m. Sigrid Simonson. Employed since 1918 at Haraldsons Herrkläder AB, became owner of the company in 1943 and business agent. Travels: Norway, Denmark, Spain, France, Italy, Germany, Scotland, Portugal, Africa. Awarded by the Swedish Rowing Federation, Örgryte Sports Society's sprint race, D.M. and S.M. in rowing, D.M. and C.M. in bowling. Hobby: Bowling. 

LÖWENHARD, Eric Hugo Hilding, Bank Director, Stockholm, b. Nässjö 7/4 1892, son of Lieutenant H L and Anna Wadner, m. Ingeborg Lundblad. Completed secondary education. Employed at Smal Enskilda Bank in Nässjö and Jönköping 1908-1916, head of department at Sv Hdlsbkn Sthlm 1916-1917, assistant cashier in Umeå 1918-1919, director in Skellefteå 1919-1922, deputy director in Gävle and Uppsala 1922, director in Kristianstad 1923-1926, department director in Nyköping 1926-1937, in Falun 1937-1938, director and board member of Stockholm's directors and head of district since 1938. Board member of Sv Yllekoncernen AB and others. Travels: Germany, Belgium, Switzerland, Italy, Czechoslovakia, Austria.
